TitleSelect: Understanding Drugs: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Understanding Drugs: Impact and Perspectives"
ListenList: Do you think alcohol is a drug?
Maria believes alcohol is a drug because it affects the mind.
John thinks alcohol is different from other drugs because it is socially accepted.
Anna agrees that alcohol is a drug due to its addictive properties.
What is alcoholism?
Maria says alcoholism is an addiction to alcohol.
John believes alcoholism is a chronic disease that needs treatment.
Anna thinks alcoholism is when someone cannot control their drinking habits.
Do you know of any alcoholics?
Maria knows a family member who struggles with alcoholism.
John has a friend who is an alcoholic.
Anna does not know any alcoholics personally.
How do you stop being an alcoholic?
Maria thinks professional help and support groups are necessary.
John believes willpower and a strong support system are crucial.
Anna thinks therapy and medical treatment are essential.
Do you know how much alcohol is in beer?
Maria says beer usually contains about 5% alcohol.
John thinks the alcohol content in beer varies.
Anna believes most beers have around 4-6% alcohol.
Do you know how much alcohol is in whiskey?
Maria knows whiskey typically has about 40% alcohol.
John says whiskey has a higher alcohol content, around 40-50%.
Anna thinks whiskey contains about 35-45% alcohol.
What are some of the characteristics of drunk people?
Maria says drunk people often have slurred speech and impaired coordination.
John thinks drunk people can become very emotional.
Anna believes drunk people may have difficulty walking and making decisions.
Is alcohol addictive? What about tea, coffee, and chocolate?
Maria believes alcohol is addictive, but tea, coffee, and chocolate are less so.
John thinks all these substances can be addictive to some extent.
Anna says alcohol is more addictive than tea, coffee, or chocolate.
Should marijuana be illegal?
Maria believes marijuana should be illegal because it can be harmful.
John thinks marijuana should be legal for medical use.
Anna supports the legalization of marijuana for both medical and recreational use.
Do you think marijuana should be legal or illegal? Support your opinion with facts.
Maria thinks marijuana should be illegal due to its potential for abuse.
John believes it should be legal with regulations, citing its medical benefits.
Anna supports legalization, highlighting its economic and health benefits.
Why do you think marijuana is illegal?
Maria thinks marijuana is illegal because of its potential to impair judgment.
John believes it is due to historical and political reasons.
Anna thinks it's illegal because of societal stigma and lack of education.
Is marijuana grown in your country?
Maria says marijuana is grown illegally in some areas.
John thinks there are both legal and illegal cultivation practices.
Anna knows there are strict regulations around marijuana cultivation.
What are some ways drug users use marijuana?
Maria says people smoke marijuana or use it in edibles.
John mentions vaping and using marijuana oils.
Anna says marijuana can be used in tinctures and topicals as well.
Do you think tobacco companies would like to sell marijuana?
Maria thinks tobacco companies would benefit from selling marijuana.
John believes they would because it represents a new market.
Anna agrees, as it would diversify their product offerings.
Why do you think that tobacco is a legal drug?
Maria thinks tobacco is legal due to its historical use and economic impact.
John believes it is legal because it is a significant source of tax revenue.
Anna thinks it is legal because of its deep-rooted presence in society.
Are any of your friends addicted to tobacco?
Maria has a friend who smokes heavily.
John knows several people who are addicted to tobacco.
Anna does not have any friends addicted to tobacco.
What are the different ways to use tobacco?
Maria says people smoke cigarettes and cigars.
John mentions chewing tobacco and using snuff.
Anna knows some people use tobacco in hookahs and pipes.
Do you know anyone who smokes a pipe?
Maria's grandfather smokes a pipe.
John knows an old neighbor who smokes a pipe.
Anna does not know anyone who smokes a pipe.
What is the difference between pipe tobacco and cigarette tobacco?
Maria says pipe tobacco is usually coarser and has different flavors.
John believes pipe tobacco is often more natural and less processed.
Anna thinks the main difference is in the way they are cured and cut.
What do you think about chewing tobacco?
Maria thinks chewing tobacco is harmful and should be avoided.
John believes it is as dangerous as smoking.
Anna thinks it is an outdated practice that carries significant health risks.

seo.Title: Understanding Drugs: Impact and Perspectives
seo.metaTitle: Understanding Drugs: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Understanding Drugs: Impact and Perspectives"
seo.metaDescription: Explore the impact of drugs on society and understand various perspectives on their use and regulation.

contentArray.content: Drugs have a profound impact on individuals and society, influencing health, behavior, and legal frameworks.
Exploring different perspectives on drug legalization helps us understand societal attitudes and policies.
Alcoholism is a serious condition characterized by addiction to alcohol and compulsive alcohol consumption.
Legalization debates around marijuana highlight complex issues of public health and criminal justice.
